The field will appear for the requester only when the "Requester can edit" option is enabled. This is the default behavior.           2. How do we restrict the catalog item visibility based on the requester’s location?     The visibility of the service item can be restricted only based on the agent and requester groups, as shown below.         You can also add the requester to groups based on their respective locations and select the groups for which the item must be visible.       3.  How do I ensure the visibility of employee off-boarding bundle item?   The Employee offboarding bundled item will be visible only under the HR workspace by default when multiple workspaces are created.         4. How to hide a specific service item from all the requesters?     By default, we can only set the visibility based on requester groups.      Create a dummy requester group and add a dummy requester profile as a workaround. Now, give visibility only to this group. This way, you can hide the item from all the requesters.       5. How do I ensure the “Request for someone else” option shows for the requester?   Click on the “Place request” option to get the “Request for someone else” field to be displayed.

title: Why is there a need for team huddle when a private note can be added with the ability to tag agents?
description: Team Huddle has the added advantage of allowing agents to highlight conversations and bring them to the notice of specific team members. It allows tagging a group of agents as well.
desc_un_html: Team Huddle has the added advantage of allowing agents to highlight conversations and bring them to the notice of specific team members. It allows tagging a group of agents as well.

title: Is Team huddle a real time chat feature?
description: Yes, it is real-time. We even have notifications so you would be notified immediately once a message is posted in a Huddle you are part of.
desc_un_html: Yes, it is real-time. We even have notifications so you would be notified immediately once a message is posted in a Huddle you are part of.

title: How to enable team huddle?
description:
If your Freshservice account is a Non-Business team (ESM) account and is located in the US data centre, you can enable the team huddle feature by following the steps below,


  1. Go to Admin > Automation & Productivity > Agent Productivity > Team huddle.
  2. Turn on the toggle switch to enable the feature.
  3. Customize the settings as per your requirements.
  4. Click Save to apply the changes.
desc_un_html: If your Freshservice account is a Non-Business team (ESM) account and is located in the US data centre, you can enable the team huddle feature by following the steps below,      Go to Admin > Automation & Productivity > Agent Productivity > Team huddle.  Turn on the toggle switch to enable the feature.  Customize the settings as per your requirements.  Click Save to apply the changes.
seo_data-meta_title: Enabling the team huddle feature in Freshservice.
seo-data-meta_description: If you have a Non-Business team (ESM) account in the US data center, you can enable the Team Huddle (Discuss) feature.

title: Differentiate between Incidents and Service Requests?
description:
An unplanned interruption, reduction in the quality or the failure of an IT service is called an incident.
A request from a user for information, advice, a standard change, or access to a service is termed a service request.
desc_un_html: An unplanned interruption, reduction in the quality or the failure of an IT service is called an incident. A request from a user for information, advice, a standard change, or access to a service is termed a service request.

title: Why do you merge 2 tickets?
description: When an issue gets reported multiple times by the same user or a requester raises a new ticket instead of following up on an existing one, duplicate tickets can be merged together. To know more about what happens when we merge tickets, you can refer to the article here
desc_un_html: When an issue gets reported multiple times by the same user or a requester raises a new ticket instead of following up on an existing one, duplicate tickets can be merged together. To know more about what happens when we merge tickets, you can refer to the article here

title: Can we associate a ticket to a change directly?
description:
Both Incidents and Service Requests can be associated with Changes. To associate a ticket with a change,


  1. Go to the Ticket view page for the ticket you want to associate with a change.
  2. Select the Associations tab and click on the Associate button.
  3. Choose the appropriate option from the two given:
    • Change initiated by this ticket:  to associate or create a new change that was the reason for the ticket
    • Change initiating this ticket:  to associate a change that was the reason for creating the ticket

  4. Depending on the selection, a pop-up window will appear with either the fields for creating a new change or a list of existing changes to choose from.
desc_un_html: Both Incidents and Service Requests can be associated with Changes. To associate a ticket with a change,      Go to the Ticket view page for the ticket you want to associate with a change.  Select the Associations tab and click on the Associate button.  Choose the appropriate option from the two given:  Change initiated by this ticket:  to associate or create a new change that was the reason for the ticket  Change initiating this ticket:  to associate a change that was the reason for creating the ticket      Depending on the selection, a pop-up window will appear with either the fields for creating a new change or a list of existing changes to choose from.

title: What is the purpose of adding a watcher to a ticket?
description:
In situations where an agent might need to monitor a ticket which is assigned to another agent in the team, the ‘Add watcher’ feature can be used. 
When you are added as a watcher to a ticket, you will receive email notifications when there is activity on the ticket, like the addition of a note, a change in status, etc.
desc_un_html: In situations where an agent might need to monitor a ticket which is assigned to another agent in the team, the ‘Add watcher’ feature can be used.  When you are added as a watcher to a ticket, you will receive email notifications when there is activity on the ticket, like the addition of a note, a change in status, etc.

title: How to remove a watcher from a ticket?
description: Once you are added as a watcher to a ticket, you can remove yourself from watcher list by clicking on the “Star” icon within the ticket. You can only remove yourself from the watcher list and can’t remove other agents.
desc_un_html: Once you are added as a watcher to a ticket, you can remove yourself from watcher list by clicking on the “Star” icon within the ticket. You can only remove yourself from the watcher list and can’t remove other agents.

title: Can watchers be non agents?
description: We can’t add non-agents as watchers to tickets. This feature is restricted to agents.
desc_un_html: We can’t add non-agents as watchers to tickets. This feature is restricted to agents.

title: How to modify the due date of a ticket?
description:
Freshservice displays a ticket's due date and time, based on the applied SLA. You can view the due date and time in the top right corner of the ticket view page under the following categories:

  • Priority: The assigned priority based on the applied SLA
  • First response due: The due time for the first response from the agent. This can be a reply or a public note triggered by an agent manually.
  • Resolution due: The current due date and time are based on the applied SLA. This value may be updated based on changes in the ticket properties like status.

By default, the first response due of a ticket cannot be edited. However, to change the resolution due to an unresolved ticket, follow these steps:

  1. Go to the Ticket View page and click on the pencil icon next to the Resolution due date and time.
  2. Choose one of the applicable preset values like today, tomorrow, this week, next week, and this month. These values will be calculated from the created date and time of the ticket.
  3. Select the Pick date and time option if you want to set the due date and time to a specific date and time.


    Please note that the ability to edit the resolution due can be restricted using an app. If you cannot find the edit option, check if the app Ticket Due by property customization is installed in your portal.

This can be a reply or a public note triggered by an agent manually.  Resolution due: The current due date and time are based on the applied SLA. This value may be updated based on changes in the ticket properties like status.     By default, the first response due of a ticket cannot be edited. title: Can requesters see conversations agents have with third parties?
description: No, requesters would not be able to see any conversation that has been forwarded to a third party. The same goes for replies from the third party as these get added as private notes.
desc_un_html: No, requesters would not be able to see any conversation that has been forwarded to a third party. The same goes for replies from the third party as these get added as private notes.

title: Why do some tickets have approval tab and some don't?
description: Approvals are available only for Service requests and not available for Incidents.
desc_un_html: Approvals are available only for Service requests and not available for Incidents.

title: What are the bulk actions available for tickets?
description:
Freshservice offers various bulk actions to manage tickets in bulk efficiently as part of your IT service management. Some of the bulk actions available for tickets in Freshservice are:

  1. Close: Close multiple tickets simultaneously based on their status, requester, or other criteria.
  2. Reopen: Reopen multiple closed tickets at once, allowing agents to continue working on them.
  3. Delete: Delete multiple tickets at once based on their status, requester, or any other criteria.
  4. Merge: Merge multiple tickets into one ticket, making managing and tracking customer inquiries easier.
  5. Assign: Assign multiple tickets to one or more agents or groups, ensuring that they are being handled by the right person.
  6. Status change: Change the status of multiple tickets at once, such as marking them as resolved, pending, or on hold.
  7. Priority change: Change the priority of multiple tickets at once, ensuring that high-priority issues are addressed first.
  8. Add reply: Add replies to multiple tickets at once, saving time for agents who need to respond to similar inquiries.
  9. Impact change: Change the impact of multiple tickets at once, such as marking them as low, medium, or high impact.
  10. Urgency change: Change the urgency of multiple tickets at once, such as marking them as low, medium, or high urgency.
  11. Change assigned agent and group: Change the assigned agent or group of multiple tickets at once, ensuring that they are being handled by the right person or team.
  12. Asset type change: Change the asset type of multiple tickets at once, making tracking issues related to specific assets easier.
  13. Source change: Change the source of multiple tickets at once, such as marking them as phone, email, or chat.
  14. Department change: Change the department of multiple tickets at once, ensuring that they are being handled by the right team.
  15. Category change: Change the category of multiple tickets at once, making it easier to filter and categorize them.
  16. Add tags: Add tags to multiple tickets at once, making it easier to filter and categorize them.


These bulk actions can save a lot of time and effort for agents and service desk managers, making it easier to manage tickets efficiently.

title: Why have tags when there are filters?
description: As an agent when you are working on tickets or accessing articles, characterizing them by adding a tag would help to track and segregate them with respect to issues or requests. You can filter tickets by tags and use them for reporting. Tags also serve the purpose of indexing search for solution articles.
desc_un_html: As an agent when you are working on tickets or accessing articles, characterizing them by adding a tag would help to track and segregate them with respect to issues or requests. You can filter tickets by tags and use them for reporting. Tags also serve the purpose of indexing search for solution articles.

title: Creating incident categories in Freshservice
description:
Creating incident categories in Freshservice can help you classify, track, and prioritize tickets. It also helps streamline communication and ensure that the right team members handle the right issues.

Here's how you can create incident categories in Freshservice:

  1. Go to Admin > Service Management > Service Desk Settings > Field Manager.
  2. Click on Ticket Fields and scroll down to the Category option.
  3. Click on the Pencil icon next to add new categories.
  4. Under the Properties pop-up window, set the behavior for agents and requesters.
  5. Under the Nested field Labels section, you can create the categories and sub-categories as per the hierarchical levels.

    Note: When fetching a reader output and assigning a nested field in an action, only the first sub-category in a custom object can be assigned, even if multiple sub-categories exist.
  6. Alternatively, use the free-form text area to add or edit items for your dropdown. You can indent items by pressing the tab key once or twice, which will automatically be converted to dropdown items based on the indentation.
  7. Click Done and Save the changes.


Once you have created the categories, you can use them to classify tickets as they come in. When agents create a new ticket, they will be prompted to select an incident category from the dropdown menu. The selected category will then be visible on the ticket view, and you can use it to track and prioritize issues.

It also helps streamline communication and ensure that the right team members handle the right issues. You can indent items by pressing the tab key once or twice, which will automatically be converted to dropdown items based on the indentation.  Click Done and Save the changes. The selected category will then be visible on the ticket view, and you can use it to track and prioritize issues.

seo-data-meta_description: By organizing issues into categories, you can streamline communication, ensure that tickets are handled by the right team members, and prioritize tasks to meet your business needs.

title: How do sub-categories work?
description: Sub Categories work as the second level of categorization for your ticket. Make sure to provide a single tab spacing from the margin when adding sub-categories in admin-> form fields -> shared fields -> categories.
desc_un_html: Sub Categories work as the second level of categorization for your ticket. Make sure to provide a single tab spacing from the margin when adding sub-categories in admin-> form fields -> shared fields -> categories.

title: How do I change the Service Desk's Time Zone?
description: You will find the option to modify the service desk timezone in Admin-->Service Desk Rebranding.
desc_un_html: You will find the option to modify the helpdesk timezone in Admin-->Helpdesk Rebranding.

title: How do I change my own Agent Profile's Time Zone?
description: Click on your profile icon on the top right corner of the page and choose Profile Settings. Here you would see the option to change the Timezone for your profile.
desc_un_html: Click on your profile icon on the top right corner of the page and choose Profile Settings. Here you would see the option to change the Timezone for your profile.

title: How to configure business hours?
description: As an Administrator for Freshservice, you can configure Business hours by navigating to Admin-->General Settings-->Business Hours. You can choose to edit the Default Business hour or also create multiple business hours for different teams across regions. For more information on this refer to the article here.
desc_un_html: As an Administrator for Freshservice, you can configure Business hours by navigating to Admin-->General Settings-->Business Hours. You can choose to edit the Default Business hour or also create multiple business hours for different teams across regions. For more information on this refer to the article here.

title: How to set holidays and change calendar holidays to working day?
description: When adding your business hours, you can define the Yearly Holiday List either manually or by importing a country's holiday list by specifying the region. The holidays will be ignored when calculating SLAs for a ticket as they are treated as non-working days. Removing an existing holiday from the list would make Freshservice treat it as a working day.
desc_un_html: When adding your business hours, you can define the Yearly Holiday List either manually or by importing a country's holiday list by specifying the region. The holidays will be ignored when calculating SLAs for a ticket as they are treated as non-working days. Removing an existing holiday from the list would make Freshservice treat it as a working day.

title: Is a private note counted as a response under SLA Policies?
description: When you add a private note to a ticket, since it is not visible to the requester,  it is not considered as a response.
desc_un_html: When you add a private note to a ticket, since it is not visible to the requester,  it is not considered as a response.

title: How to send escalation emails to an agent who has not responded on a ticket for a definitive period of time?
description: You can configure SLA policies such that there’s an escalation email triggered to the Assigned Agent before an ‘x’ period of time if there has been no response on the ticket. To do this, navigate to Admin-->Service Management --> Service desk settings -->SLA and OLA Policies and create a new SLA policy or edit the existing one and you would have the option for the same.
desc_un_html: You can configure SLA policies such that there’s an escalation email triggered to the Assigned Agent before an ‘x’ period of time if there has been no response on the ticket. To do this, navigate to Admin-->Service Management --> Service desk settings -->SLA and OLA Policies and create a new SLA policy or edit the existing one and you would have the option for the same.

title: Can individual SLA policies be set up for different categories?
description: When creating an SLA policy under Admin-->General Settings-->SLA policies, Freshservice allows you to specify under what conditions the policy is applicable. You can choose to apply a particular SLA policy for each category.
desc_un_html: When creating an SLA policy under Admin-->General Settings-->SLA policies, Freshservice allows you to specify under what conditions the policy is applicable. You can choose to apply a particular SLA policy for each category.

title: Which agent is attributed under the Tickets resolved/Resolution metric when there are multiple agents working on a particular ticket?
description: In cases where multiple agents worked on a particular ticket, the ticket would be attributed to the agent who is currently assigned the ticket when calculating Tickets resolved/Resolution metrics.
desc_un_html: In cases where multiple agents worked on a particular ticket, the ticket would be attributed to the agent who is currently assigned the ticket when calculating Tickets resolved/Resolution metrics.

title: Will the reopening of a Resolved ticket count against Average Resolution time?
description: Yes, reopening a resolved ticket would affect average resolution time as the ticket is being put back to open status where the SLA clock will continue to run.
desc_un_html: Yes, reopening a resolved ticket would affect average resolution time as the ticket is being put back to open status where the SLA clock will continue to run.

title: What is the difference between "response due" and "overdue"?
description: The Response Due tag gets added to a ticket when there has been no response on the ticket by an agent and the ticket is past its First response SLA. The Overdue tag gets added if a ticket’s resolution SLA has been violated and it is past the Due by date.
desc_un_html: The Response Due tag gets added to a ticket when there has been no response on the ticket by an agent and the ticket is past its First response SLA. The Overdue tag gets added if a ticket’s resolution SLA has been violated and it is past the Due by date.

title: How to disable/enable email notifications?
description: You can enable/disable email notifications by navigating to Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications. However, please note that there are few system notifications which can’t be disabled.
desc_un_html: You can enable/disable email notifications by navigating to Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications. However, please note that there are few system notifications which can’t be disabled.

title: How do I notify agents when a ticket is created on my Freshservice?
description:
You would need to add agents to the notify agents section available under Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications-->New Ticket Created(Agent Notification). 




Click on the edit button next to notify agents. Here you can choose the particular agents who need to be notified when a new ticket has been created.
desc_un_html: You would need to add agents to the notify agents section available under Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications-->New Ticket Created(Agent Notification).            Click on the edit button next to notify agents. Here you can choose the particular agents who need to be notified when a new ticket has been created.

title: How to enable ticket creation email notifications for non-agents?
description: We will be able to enable ticket creation email notifications for requesters. The navigation path for this is Admin -> Account settings -> Email notifications -> Requester notification and enable the 'New ticket created' notification for requesters as shown in the below image.
desc_un_html: We will be able to enable ticket creation email notifications for requesters. The navigation path for this is Admin -> Account settings -> Email notifications -> Requester notification and enable the 'New ticket created' notification for requesters as shown in the below image.

title: Why am I, as an agent, not getting notifications when a new ticket is created?
description: If an agent is not receiving notifications for new ticket creation, please check with the administrator if the agent’s name has been added to the ‘Notify’ list under Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications-->New Ticket Created (Agent Notification)
desc_un_html: If an agent is not receiving notifications for new ticket creation, please check with the administrator if the agent’s name has been added to the ‘Notify’ list under Admin-->General Settings-->Email Notifications-->New Ticket Created (Agent Notification)

title: How do I stop my users from receiving an email to sign up for the portal?
description:
You can disable the “User Activation Email” notification under Admin--> General Settings→ Email Notifications to sign up for Freshservice. However, there is no email notification present for the ''User invitation'' email which gets auto-generated from the backend. Read below to understand the difference between User Activation Email and User Invitation Email.

User Activation Email: This email is sent to the users once they have signed up for a Freshservice account while they have previously signed up for Freshdesk,Freshchat, Freshsales or any other product part of the Freshworks Organization. This can be edited from Email notifications and can be enabled/disabled.

User Invitation Email: This email is sent to the users once they have newly signed up for Freshservice or any other account part of the Freshworks Organization. They will not be a previously existing user of any product of Freshworks, in this case. For disabling this, please reach out to support@freshservice.com
desc_un_html: You can disable the “User Activation Email” notification under Admin--> General Settings→ Email Notifications to sign up for Freshservice. However, there is no email notification present for the ''User invitation'' email which gets auto-generated from the backend. Read below to understand the difference between User Activation Email and User Invitation Email.  User Activation Email: This email is sent to the users once they have signed up for a Freshservice account while they have previously signed up for Freshdesk,Freshchat, Freshsales or any other product part of the Freshworks Organization. This can be edited from Email notifications and can be enabled/disabled.  User Invitation Email: This email is sent to the users once they have newly signed up for Freshservice or any other account part of the Freshworks Organization. They will not be a previously existing user of any product of Freshworks, in this case. For disabling this, please reach out to support@freshservice.com

title: How to edit the automatic email notifications in Freshdesk?
description:
Using Freshdesk’s automatic email notifications, you can prioritize your work and be aware of new tickets, customer responses, and much more from within your helpdesk.

 

Please follow the below steps to edit the email notifications to customize them per your business requirement.


  1. Login to your Freshdesk account as an administrator.

  2. Navigate to Admin from the menu. Select Workflows and click on Email Notifications.

  3. Click on the Edit icon next to any email notification.

  4. You can make use of the “Insert Placeholder” option to add dynamic content and personalize the email subject and its content.

  5. Click Save.
desc_un_html: Using Freshdesk’s automatic email notifications, you can prioritize your work and be aware of new tickets, customer responses, and much more from within your helpdesk.     Please follow the below steps to edit the email notifications to customize them per your business requirement.       Login to your Freshdesk account as an administrator.    Navigate to Admin from the menu. Select Workflows and click on Email Notifications.    Click on the Edit icon next to any email notification.    You can make use of the “Insert Placeholder” option to add dynamic content and personalize the email subject and its content.    Click Save.
seo_data-meta_title: How to edit the automatic email notifications in Freshdesk?
seo-data-meta_description: You can click on the Edit icon next to any email notification and make use of the “Insert Placeholder” option to add dynamic content and personalize the email subject and its content.

title: How to notify the Requester when a ticket is closed or resolved?
description: There are default notifications available for requesters under Email Notifications which notify the requester when the status of a ticket is updated to either Resolved or Closed.
desc_un_html: There are default notifications available for requesters under Email Notifications which notify the requester when the status of a ticket is updated to either Resolved or Closed.

title: How to stop the close ticket notification for a particular ticket?
description: We would not be able to stop the close ticket notification for a particular ticket. However, if you use our keyboard shortcuts as below, the closure notification would be skipped for that particular ticket. Try closing the ticket by using the Keyboard shortcut (Alt + ~) or you can press Shift and click on the close button on top of the ticket
desc_un_html: We would not be able to stop the close ticket notification for a particular ticket. However, if you use our keyboard shortcuts as below, the closure notification would be skipped for that particular ticket. Try closing the ticket by using the Keyboard shortcut (Alt + ~) or you can press Shift and click on the close button on top of the ticket

title: How to setup email notification for response and resolution violations?
description:
We have both First Response SLA notification and Resolution time SLA notification available under Email notifications which can be edited to include custom information if needed. You can navigate to Admin-->Email Notifications and find the notification templates under Agent Notification.



Please note that these notifications work only when you have configured Ticket Escalations setup in your SLA policy
desc_un_html: We have both First Response SLA notification and Resolution time SLA notification available under Email notifications which can be edited to include custom information if needed. You can navigate to Admin-->Email Notifications and find the notification templates under Agent Notification.          Please note that these notifications work only when you have configured Ticket Escalations setup in your SLA policy

title: How to notify the Requester if an agent adds a public note to the ticket?
description: We have a default notification available for requesters under Email Notifications which notifies the requester when an agent adds a public note to the ticket.
desc_un_html: We have a default notification available for requesters under Email Notifications which notifies the requester when an agent adds a public note to the ticket.

title: Can reports be scheduled to run on a timed schedule?
description: Yes, reports can be scheduled to be run daily, weekly or monthly at the selected time. Once you're done creating a new report , save changes and click on 'schedule report' as shown in the below image to start scheduling the report
desc_un_html: Yes, reports can be scheduled to be run daily, weekly or monthly at the selected time. Once you're done creating a new report , save changes and click on 'schedule report' as shown in the below image to start scheduling the report

title: How can scheduled reports be auto-emailed to recipients in say a PDF form?
description: Reports can be scheduled to be sent out to multiple people in PDF,CSV or XLS format by selecting the schedule option after saving a custom report created.
desc_un_html: Reports can be scheduled to be sent out to multiple people in PDF,CSV or XLS format by selecting the schedule option after saving a custom report created.

title: Is it possible to create a report that shows sub-category & item?
description: Yes, you can go to Report->New Ticket Reports. Freshservice allows you to add ticket fields as additional columns to the report’s tabular data. You can select Category, subcategory and Items from the list of supported fields. But paragraph fields cannot be added into Reports.
desc_un_html: Yes, you can go to Report->New Ticket Reports. Freshservice allows you to add ticket fields as additional columns to the report’s tabular data. You can select Category, subcategory and Items from the list of supported fields. But paragraph fields cannot be added into Reports.

title: From which plan is scheduled reporting available?
description: Scheduling the report option is available only for Pro and Enterprise plans.
desc_un_html: Scheduling the report option is available only for Pro and Enterprise plans.

title: How to get a report with the exact time taken to resolve an incident?
description: You can do that by navigating to Reports>New report, selecting the filters ‘Ticket Type is Incident’ and ‘Resolution time in BHRS equals X’.
desc_un_html: You can do that by navigating to Reports>New report, selecting the filters ‘Ticket Type is Incident’ and ‘Resolution time in BHRS equals X’.

title: How to create a report with filter by Location?
description: The requester location can be filtered out by creating a new custom report from Reports>New reports>drag and drop a 'Chart'>Set metrics as 'Users' and selecting the filter requester location as required. Please refer the below image for setting up a report with filter by Location.
desc_un_html: The requester location can be filtered out by creating a new custom report from Reports>New reports>drag and drop a 'Chart'>Set metrics as 'Users' and selecting the filter requester location as required. Please refer the below image for setting up a report with filter by Location.

title: How often do the reports get updated data?
description: Any changes made in the Freshservice application, such as creating a new ticket or editing a field, will sync to the Analytics reports at regular intervals. The sync usually completes in about 30 minutes but can occasionally take longer.
desc_un_html: Any changes made in the Freshservice application, such as creating a new ticket or editing a field, will sync to the Analytics reports at regular intervals. The sync usually completes in about 30 minutes but can occasionally take longer.

title: How is the Average First response time calculated in reports?
description:
The average first response time is calculated based on the time taken for the very first response to be sent by an Agent to a requester.
Note: When you add a private note to a ticket since it is not visible to the requester,  it is not considered a first response.
desc_un_html: The average first response time is calculated based on the time taken for the very first response to be sent by an Agent to a requester. Note: When you add a private note to a ticket since it is not visible to the requester,  it is not considered a first response.

title: How is the Average response time calculated in reports?
description: Average response time is calculated as the average time taken by an agent to respond to a requester. This takes into consideration all agent-requester correspondence in the given period and not just the first response
desc_un_html: Average response time is calculated as the average time taken by an agent to respond to a requester. This takes into consideration all agent-requester correspondence in the given period and not just the first response

title: How is the Average resolution time calculated in reports?
description: Average resolution time is the total time taken to resolve tickets during the selected time period divided by the number of tickets resolved in the selected time period.
desc_un_html: Average resolution time is the total time taken to resolve tickets during the selected time period divided by the number of tickets resolved in the selected time period.

title: How to generate a report on billable work done by an agent?
description: You can create a Time Sheet report for getting the billable work done by an agent. Navigate to Analytics -> New Report -> Drag and drop a chart -> Enter 'Timesheet' in Metric and include 'Billable is true' , Agent name is 'agent_name' as shown in the below image. You change the agent name under edit, and you also have the option to group by company, date, agent, group, or name.
desc_un_html: You can create a Time Sheet report for getting the billable work done by an agent. Navigate to Analytics -> New Report -> Drag and drop a chart -> Enter 'Timesheet' in Metric and include 'Billable is true' , Agent name is 'agent_name' as shown in the below image. You change the agent name under edit, and you also have the option to group by company, date, agent, group, or name.

title: How to get the ticket property fields data from a report?
description: You can construct report filters using default/custom ticket fields. Freshservice also allows you to add ticket fields as additional columns to the report’s tabular data. You can click on the 'gear icon' to add more fields by searching it in the column.
desc_un_html: You can construct report filters using default/custom ticket fields. Freshservice also allows you to add ticket fields as additional columns to the report’s tabular data. You can click on the 'gear icon' to add more fields by searching it in the column.

title: How to get a report of overall trending in my service desk?
description: You can use the default report, Service Desk At A Glance. This report shows you a quick overview of the core metrics in your support and gives you a good idea of the overall trend in your ServiceDesk.
desc_un_html: You can use the default report, Helpdesk At A Glance. This report shows you a quick overview of the core metrics in your support and gives you a good idea of the overall trend in your ServiceDesk.

title: How do I go about including the serial number of assets in the report?
description: Create a new asset report. Since ‘Serial Number’ is only present for ‘Hardware’ assets, you must filter by Root CI type as 'Hardware'’ and CI Type as 'Laptop' or any other CI type to get the serial number data.
desc_un_html: Create a new asset report. Since ‘Serial Number’ is only present for ‘Hardware’ assets, you must filter by Root CI type as 'Hardware'’ and CI Type as 'Laptop' or any other CI type to get the serial number data.

title: How to show all the assets that are not used by a user?
description: Create a new Asset report and have “All Assets” selected under Asset type and then select the filter ‘Used by is none’.
desc_un_html: Create a new Asset report and have “All Assets” selected under Asset type and then select the filter ‘Used by is none’.

title: How to export all of the customer satisfaction histories for an agent?
description: The 'Employee Satisfaction Report' in the curated reports has all the basic widgets that are required to get the satisfaction survey analysis. In addition to this, you could create a Custom Report to get the data on the basis of a Specific Agent.
desc_un_html: The 'Employee Satisfaction Report' in the curated reports has all the basic widgets that are required to get the satisfaction survey analysis. In addition to this, you could create a Custom Report to get the data on the basis of a Specific Agent.

title: How to select multiple groups when creating a custom report?
description: 1. You can select the filter, groups “includes,” and have multiple groups set there.
desc_un_html: You can select the filter, groups “includes,” and have multiple groups set there.

title: How to get a report of the softwares in the asset?
description: Create a report by choosing ''Software'' as the metric and add the other filters according to your requirement and you can also make use of the ''group by'' filter there.
desc_un_html: Create a report by choosing ''Software'' as the metric and add the other filters according to your requirement and you can also make use of the ''group by'' filter there.

title: How to get a report that shows the current state of the asset?
description: Create a new asset report. Only Hardware and its child asset types have the ‘Asset state’ property. Therefore, filter by the appropriate asset type. ‘Asset state’ should now be available in the report filters. Use this to get the required data.
desc_un_html: Create a new asset report. Only Hardware and its child asset types have the ‘Asset state’ property. Therefore, filter by the appropriate asset type. ‘Asset state’ should now be available in the report filters. Use this to get the required data.

title: How is the Number of Reopens calculated?
description: ‘Number of Reopens’ is a metric that gives the total number of tickets that have been reopened from a closed or resolved status. (Ticket Status changed back from Resolved/Closed to Open). Create a New Report with a widget choosing ''Tickets'' as the metric and enter ''Reopen Count'' and choose the option according to your requirement.
desc_un_html: ‘Number of Reopens’ is a metric that gives the total number of tickets that have been reopened from a closed or resolved status. (Ticket Status changed back from Resolved/Closed to Open). Create a New Report with a widget choosing ''Tickets'' as the metric and enter ''Reopen Count'' and choose the option according to your requirement.

title: How to pull reports of service requests that came in?
description: You can use the report filter ‘Ticket type' is 'Service Request’ when creating a New report.
desc_un_html: You can use the report filter ‘Ticket type' is 'Service Request’ when creating a New report.

title: What is the date range available for default and custom reports?
description: For default reports, it is from 2013-present. For custom reports it is from 2010-2023
desc_un_html: For default reports, it is from 2013-present. For custom reports it is from 2010-2023

title: Why do I see the number of resolved tickets more than received in a report?
description: When a date range is selected, any ticket resolved in the date range will show up which is why sometimes, the count of resolved tickets appears to be more than received.
desc_un_html: When a date range is selected, any ticket resolved in the date range will show up which is why sometimes, the count of resolved tickets appears to be more than received.

title: What is the difference between Average Customer Interactions and Average Agent Interactions?
description:
The average number of interactions an agent requires to resolve the tickets is a measure of how well the agent knows the product or service, and how good he is at communicating that to the customer. The average number of customer interactions for a particular customer’s tickets show whether the customer is a new user or a power user, or if she is a supportive/happy customer or a problematic/unhappy customer.


Tip - Ideally, you should have fewer agent and customer interactions on each ticket.
desc_un_html: The average number of interactions an agent requires to resolve the tickets is a measure of how well the agent knows the product or service, and how good he is at communicating that to the customer. The average number of customer interactions for a particular customer’s tickets show whether the customer is a new user or a power user, or if she is a supportive/happy customer or a problematic/unhappy customer.     Tip - Ideally, you should have fewer agent and customer interactions on each ticket.

title: Does the response time in the ticket include weekends?
description: The report calculates the response time based on the Business hours of your servicedesk.
desc_un_html: The report calculates the response time based on the Business hours of your servicedesk.

title: What does the red and green arrow in the default reports signify and how is the percentile calculated?
description: The green and red arrows indicate the rise and fall of metrics in the current time range compared to the same duration in the past.
desc_un_html: The green and red arrows indicate the rise and fall of metrics in the current time range compared to the same duration in the past.

title: How to find the first response status of a ticket for which there is no first response given?
description: You can use the first response escalated filter under Reports>New reports.
desc_un_html: You can use the first response escalated filter under Reports>New reports.

title: How to run report on Top 10 tickets with the oldest updates?
description: Create a custom report with the appropriate filters selected to match your requirements. Add ‘Last Updated Time’ as a column in the report’s tabular data by using the ‘Add fields’ option.
desc_un_html: Create a custom report with the appropriate filters selected to match your requirements. Add ‘Last Updated Time’ as a column in the report’s tabular data by using the ‘Add fields’ option.

title: Is it possible to filter a report by OS version?
description: We can populate a report based on the OS present in an asset of type Desktop/Laptop/Computer. Create a Custom Report with the asset type set to one of the above. OS should now be available as a report filter and you can use it to generate the required report.
desc_un_html: We can populate a report based on the OS present in an asset of type Desktop/Laptop/Computer. Create a Custom Report with the asset type set to one of the above. OS should now be available as a report filter and you can use it to generate the required report.

title: How are backlog tickets in the reports calculated?
description: This is a count of all the tickets in your service desk that are currently not in resolved/closed status. So setup a report by navigating to Analytics --> New Report --> Drag and drop a chart --> Set the Date Range according to your requirement --> Status does not include ''Closed and Resolved''. And you can group by Agent name or group name according to your requirement.
desc_un_html: This is a count of all the tickets in your service desk that are currently not in resolved/closed status. So setup a report by navigating to Analytics --> New Report --> Drag and drop a chart --> Set the Date Range according to your requirement --> Status does not include ''Closed and Resolved''. And you can group by Agent name or group name according to your requirement.

title: Who would have access to reports?
description: Reports would be visible for all agents with the associated default agent role as Supervisor and above. Should your plan have custom agent roles, an agent who has been given the necessary privileges in the ‘Reports’ tab under ‘Roles->Permissions’ should have access. You can either set it up under 'Agent roles' and 'Admin roles'.
desc_un_html: Reports would be visible for all agents with the associated default agent role as Supervisor and above. Should your plan have custom agent roles, an agent who has been given the necessary privileges in the ‘Reports’ tab under ‘Roles->Permissions’ should have access. You can either set it up under 'Agent roles' and 'Admin roles'.

title: Why is there a difference between the ticket count taken in export and the report?
description: The export of the ticket count will include all the merged tickets, while the reports don’t include them. But incase there's a big difference between the widget from Reports or Dashboard and the export of tickets in your portal, please write to support@freshservice.com .
desc_un_html: The export of the ticket count will include all the merged tickets, while the reports don’t include them. But incase there's a big difference between the widget from Reports or Dashboard and the export of tickets in your portal, please write to support@freshservice.com .

title: What tickets are taken into account for the count of Resolved Tickets in reports?
description: All the Resolved and Closed Tickets will be taken into account when calculating Resolved Tickets.
desc_un_html: All the Resolved and Closed Tickets will be taken into account when calculating Resolved Tickets.

title: How do you calculate Resolution SLA%?
description: Resolution SLA% is the Number of tickets resolved within the SLA as a percentage of the total number of tickets resolved during the selected time period.
desc_un_html: Resolution SLA% is the Number of tickets resolved within the SLA as a percentage of the total number of tickets resolved during the selected time period.

title: Are there any limitations in the drill-down option for the Reports?
description: A maximum of 4 additional filters(fields) can be applied in each report.
desc_un_html: A maximum of 4 additional filters(fields) can be applied in each report.

title: Can report be generated for every custom fields created in an asset?
description: Unfortunately, the custom fields cannot be reported in reports. But the same can be achieved in Analytics. First, you will have to select the asset type and the custom fields pertaining to those fields will be listed.
desc_un_html: Unfortunately, the custom fields cannot be reported in reports. But the same can be achieved in Analytics. First, you will have to select the asset type and the custom fields pertaining to those fields will be listed.

title: In reports, under tickets by source, how does the phone, portal and email is identified if I change the source manually on some tickets?
description: Once you make the source change on some tickets this change will be reflected after the report sync time. For example, If you have a ticket #1 and you have changed its source from Email to portal then once the report sync time is crossed the ticket #1 will be under portal tickets count instead of Email.
desc_un_html: Once you make the source change on some tickets this change will be reflected after the report sync time. For example, If you have a ticket #1 and you have changed its source from Email to portal then once the report sync time is crossed the ticket #1 will be under portal tickets count instead of Email.

title: How do you calculate FCR% in Analytic report?
description:
FCR% (First contact resolution %) is the percentage of tickets that were resolved after the initial contact was made by the customer. This means that the customer interaction must be 1 for resolved tickets, irrespective of the number of responses sent by the agent. The initial description of the ticket will not be considered as a customer's response.


FCR% = % of Number of tickets resolved after the first contact made by the customer divided by the total number of tickets resolved in the selected time period.
desc_un_html: FCR% (First contact resolution %) is the percentage of tickets that were resolved after the initial contact was made by the customer. This means that the customer interaction must be 1 for resolved tickets, irrespective of the number of responses sent by the agent. The initial description of the ticket will not be considered as a customer's response.     FCR% = % of Number of tickets resolved after the first contact made by the customer divided by the total number of tickets resolved in the selected time period.

title: How are the points calculated for the Leaderboard?
description:
Every ticket that an agent handles/resolves can help him/her gain points. The number of points to be awarded to agents can be set by the Admin under Admin > Service Desk Productivity > Arcade > Arcade Settings.


The agent will receive 4 trophies based on different criteria.

  • Most Valuable Player - Agent with maximum Overall points this month

  • Customer Wow Champion - Agent with maximum Customer Satisfaction points this month

  • Sharpshooter - Agent with maximum First Call Resolution points this month

  • Speed Racer - Agent with maximum Fast Resolution points this month


For more information, visit the article below:

https://support.freshservice.com/support/solutions/articles/183566-improving-it-performance-using-freshservice-arcade
desc_un_html: Every ticket that an agent handles/resolves can help him/her gain points. The number of points to be awarded to agents can be set by the Admin under Admin > Helpdesk Productivity > Arcade > Arcade Settings.     The agent will receive 4 trophies based on different criteria.    Most Valuable Player - Agent with maximum Overall points this month    Customer Wow Champion - Agent with maximum Customer Satisfaction points this month    Sharpshooter - Agent with maximum First Call Resolution points this month    Speed Racer - Agent with maximum Fast Resolution points this month       For more information, visit the article below:  https://support.freshservice.com/support/solutions/articles/183566-improving-it-performance-using-freshservice-arcade

title: How do I create custom quests?
description: To create custom quests, please navigate to Admin -> Arcade -> Quests and choose to either edit the default quests or add new ones of your choice.
desc_un_html: To create custom quests, please navigate to Admin -> Arcade -> Quests and choose to either edit the default quests or add new ones of your choice.

title: How can I edit the level of each agent manually?
description: You can override the system and manually set the level of the agent under Admin --> Agents --> Edit (next to the agent's name) and set the level manually.
desc_un_html: You can override the system and manually set the level of the agent under Admin --> Agents --> Edit (next to the agent's name) and set the level manually.

title: Why aren't my points updated on the Leaderboard yet, even though I've completed a quest?
description:
The leaderboard is a back-end operation and, as such, takes a while to be updated. There will be a delay in updating points, based on the queue.


You can rest assured that the points will definitely be updated soon. If the delay is too long, please send an email to support@freshservice.com.
desc_un_html: The leaderboard is a back-end operation and, as such, takes a while to be updated. There will be a delay in updating points, based on the queue.     You can rest assured that the points will definitely be updated soon. If the delay is too long, please send an email to support@freshservice.com.

title: How will agents be notified when they complete a quest?
description: As of now, agents won't receive a notification on completion of a quest. However, they could always navigate to their agent profile and view the badges they've earned over time.
desc_un_html: As of now, agents won't receive a notification on completion of a quest. However, they could always navigate to their agent profile and view the badges they've earned over time.

title: What is a Sandbox?
description:
As an admin, making changes to automation rules and configurations in your production account can be tricky. However, you don’t want to be restricted from trying out new ways or improve existing configurations set up in your service desk. This is why we’re bringing Sandbox to Freshservice.


With Sandbox, you can create an out-of-the-box environment to test out workflows and configurations before syncing them to your Freshservice account (a.k.a your production account) while keeping away from ramifications. Though Sandbox is a mirror of your Freshservice account, tickets, customer data or contact will not be copied.
desc_un_html: As an admin, making changes to automation rules and configurations in your production account can be tricky. However, you don’t want to be restricted from trying out new ways or improve existing configurations set up in your service desk. This is why we’re bringing Sandbox to Freshservice.     With Sandbox, you can create an out-of-the-box environment to test out workflows and configurations before syncing them to your Freshservice account (a.k.a your production account) while keeping away from ramifications. Though Sandbox is a mirror of your Freshservice account, tickets, customer data or contact will not be copied.

title: What are the modules that get copied to your Sandbox account?
description:
The following modules will be copied to your Sandbox account:


  • Business Hours 

  • Departments & department fields

  • Requesters - (Reporting managers/Department head/Approvers/members of the CAB) 

  • Requester Fields

  • Roles & Permissions

  • Agents 

  • Groups

  • CAB

  • Locations

  • Form Fields(Tickets/Problems/Changes/Releases)

  • Service Catalog

  • SLA policies

  • Workflow Automator(All Modules)

  • Change lifecycle
desc_un_html: The following modules will be copied to your Sandbox account:       Business Hours     Departments & department fields    Requesters - (Reporting managers/Department head/Approvers/members of the CAB)     Requester Fields    Roles & Permissions    Agents     Groups    CAB    Locations    Form Fields(Tickets/Problems/Changes/Releases)    Service Catalog    SLA policies    Workflow Automator(All Modules)    Change lifecycle

title: What are the modules that do not get copied to your Sandbox account?
description:
• Tickets data

  • Ticket list views

  • Portals - logo, favicon, customization

  • Gamification

  • Apps and integrations

  • SSO and SSL settings

  • Asset Data

  • Knowledge Base
desc_un_html: Tickets data    Ticket list views    Portals - logo, favicon, customization    Gamification    Apps and integrations    SSO and SSL settings    Asset Data    Knowledge Base

title: How to setup a Sandbox account?
description:
Navigate to Admin -> Sandbox in Service Desk Productivity.


In the Sandbox Details tab, click on Create Sandbox and once the Sandbox account is created, admins will be notified via email. This will take some time based on your service desk configuration.


Click on Open Sandbox to log in to your Sandbox account in a new tab. Here, you can test out configurations before syncing them your Freshservice account.
desc_un_html: Navigate to Admin -> Sandbox in Helpdesk Productivity.     In the Sandbox Details tab, click on Create Sandbox and once the Sandbox account is created, admins will be notified via email. This will take some time based on your service desk configuration.     Click on Open Sandbox to log in to your Sandbox account in a new tab. Here, you can test out configurations before syncing them your Freshservice account.

title: Is Sandbox available in my plan?
description: Sandbox is available only on the Enterprise plan.
desc_un_html: Sandbox is available only on the Enterprise plan.

title: How to sync changes from Sandbox to my Freshservice account?
description:
Once you test out the configurations in Sandbox, go to your Sandbox account, navigate to Admin -> Sandbox in Service Desk Productivity


Click on View Changes to fetch all the changes made in your Sandbox account.


You can then click on Regenerate Change List -> Regenerate to ensure all the changes created are included in the change list before syncing them.


If there aren’t any conflict or sync errors shown in the change list, you can go ahead and click on Sync Now to have these changes synced to your Freshservice Account. 


Once the sync is successful, your sandbox account will automatically get destroyed.

You can then click on Regenerate Change List -> Regenerate to ensure all the changes created are included in the change list before syncing them.     If there aren’t any conflict or sync errors shown in the change list, you can go ahead and click on Sync Now to have these changes synced to your Freshservice Account.      Once the sync is successful, your sandbox account will automatically get destroyed.

title: How to identify if I am logged into the sandbox or production account?
description: The banner on top of the screen will indicate if you’re in your Sandbox account. Also, the URL of your sandbox account would look like this https://companyname-fs-sandbox.com.
desc_un_html: The banner on top of the screen will indicate if you’re in your Sandbox account. Also, the URL of your sandbox account would look like this https://companyname-fs-sandbox.com.

title: I received a conflict error when trying to sync from Sandbox account. What does it mean?
description:
When there are modifications to values, description or properties in both your Freshservice account and your Sandbox account.


For eg: When the group name is changed from the Information Technology team to Capacity Management in your Sandbox account and the same group is changed from the Information Technology team to IT Team in your Freshservice account as well. This will lead to Conflict.

Note: Conflict errors are not applicable for Workflow Automator and Change Lifecycle.
desc_un_html: When there are modifications to values, description or properties in both your Freshservice account and your Sandbox account.     For eg: When the group name is changed from the Information Technology team to Capacity Management in your Sandbox account and the same group is changed from the Information Technology team to IT Team in your Freshservice account as well. This will lead to Conflict.  Note: Conflict errors are not applicable for Workflow Automator and Change Lifecycle.

title: I received a Sync error when trying to sync from Sandbox account.What does it mean?
description:
This includes activities such as creation or deletion of new or existing status, transitions, node, event or action in both your Freshservice account and Sandbox account. Sync errors cannot be fixed easily like conflict errors.


For eg: When a transition is added to the status (Pending Review -> Closed) in your Sandbox account and a transition has been added to the same status (Pending Review -> Open) in your Freshservice account as well. This will lead to a Sync Error.

Note: Sync errors can happen only in Workflow Automator and Change Lifecycle.
desc_un_html: This includes activities such as creation or deletion of new or existing status, transitions, node, event or action in both your Freshservice account and Sandbox account. Sync errors cannot be fixed easily like conflict errors.     For eg: When a transition is added to the status (Pending Review -> Closed) in your Sandbox account and a transition has been added to the same status (Pending Review -> Open) in your Freshservice account as well. This will lead to a Sync Error.  Note: Sync errors can happen only in Workflow Automator and Change Lifecycle.

title: How to sync changes in case of a conflict or sync error?
description:
In case of a conflict, admins can fix the errors, click on Regenerate Change List and then click on Sync Now to have the changes copied to your Freshservice Account.


In case of a sync error, admins will have to clone that workflow/lifecycle in the sandbox account, click on Regenerate Change List and then click Sync Now to have the changes copied to your Freshservice Account.
desc_un_html: In case of a conflict, admins can fix the errors, click on Regenerate Change List and then click on Sync Now to have the changes copied to your Freshservice Account.     In case of a sync error, admins will have to clone that workflow/lifecycle in the sandbox account, click on Regenerate Change List and then click Sync Now to have the changes copied to your Freshservice Account.

title: Where can I view all the sync history?
description: You can navigate to Admin -> Sandbox -> Sync History tab in your Freshservice account and check the sync history for any particular date.
desc_un_html: You can navigate to Admin -> Sandbox -> Sync History tab in your Freshservice account and check the sync history for any particular date.

title: How to deactivate my Sandbox account without syncing changes?
description: As admins, you might not always want to sync the changes to your Freshservice account. In that case, you could also directly destroy the Sandbox created by navigating to Admin -> Sandbox -> Destroy Sandbox from your Freshservice account.
desc_un_html: As admins, you might not always want to sync the changes to your Freshservice account. In that case, you could also directly destroy the Sandbox created by navigating to Admin -> Sandbox -> Destroy Sandbox from your Freshservice account.

title: What are the changes skipped in Sandbox?
description: Few cases such as deletion of an Agent/ CAB/User/Group/Location/Department/Service item/ Service category are not captured in the change list and will not be synced to your Freshservice account as deleting such key entities would have a huge impact on existing tickets in your Freshservice account.
desc_un_html: Few cases such as deletion of an Agent/ CAB/User/Group/Location/Department/Service item/ Service category are not captured in the change list and will not be synced to your Freshservice account as deleting such key entities would have a huge impact on existing tickets in your Freshservice account.

title: What is Orchestration?
description:
Orchestration is the automated configuration, management, and coordination of computer systems, applications, and services. Orchestration helps IT to more easily manage complex tasks and workflows.


IT teams must manage many servers and applications, but doing so manually isn’t a scalable strategy. The more complex an IT system, the more complex managing all the moving parts can become. The need to combine multiple automated tasks and their configurations across groups of systems or machines increases. That’s where orchestration can help.


You can use orchestration to automate IT processes such as server provisioning, incident management, cloud orchestration, database management, application orchestration, and many other tasks and workflows.


For more details about Orchestration, please visit our solution article here: https://support.freshservice.com/en/support/solutions/articles/50000002961-introducing-orchestration-center

The more complex an IT system, the more complex managing all the moving parts can become. The need to combine multiple automated tasks and their configurations across groups of systems or machines increases. That’s where orchestration can help.     You can use orchestration to automate IT processes such as server provisioning, incident management, cloud orchestration, database management, application orchestration, and many other tasks and workflows.     For more details about Orchestration, please visit our solution article here: https://support.freshservice.com/en/support/solutions/articles/50000002961-introducing-orchestration-center

title: What is the program about?
description:
This is the Freshworks Affiliate program. We offer a suite of products to enhance businesses growing needs. Our program works like any other affiliate program. You will be rewarded for customers who signed up through your referral link.

The commission rate is a standard 15% for the first year of the life of the
customer. You will also receive 5$ every valid lead. The lead validity will be calculated by an in-house tool.

You will have access to your partner dashboard where you can track your referrals and commissions. The dashboard will have all resources/assets that you may need for getting the word out. Access your Partnerstack dashboard here, dash.partnerstack.com/login

Find more details here, https://www.freshworks.com/company/affiliate-partner/

Email/message at any point in time.

title: What is the difference between IT workspaces and Business workspaces?
description:
Workspace Creation: Workspaces created using the IT workspace template are called IT Workspaces. Workspaces created using any other workspace template (HR, Facilities, Legal, Finance, and General) are called Business Workspaces. If you use the blank template, the workspace type is determined by the primary business function selected. If IT is chosen, an IT workspace is created. If any other business function is selected, a Business workspace is created.


Distinctions: Here are the key distinctions between the two. 

  • Ticket types supported: IT and Business Workspaces will grant access to different ticket types. IT Workspaces will support Incidents, Service Requests and Major Incidents whereas Business Workspaces will support Cases (which can be prefixed as Queries/Issues/Requests). Learn more about the differences between ticket types here.

  • Features supported: Only IT workspaces will have access to IT-specific features: Problem, Change, Release, Alert, and On-Call Management. 

  • Agent Permissions: Business agents can only be granted ‘view’ access in IT Workspaces. IT and business agents can be granted 'manage' access in Business workspaces (access to modules is still governed by the modules the respective license types can access)


Please read the following articles to get a detailed overview of both types of workspaces. 

  • What is an IT workspace? 
  • What is a Business workspace?

title: What is the difference between a draft and published workspace?
description:
Draft workspace: Any workspace added to the account is created in draft mode. A draft workspace is a workspace that is being built, configured, and taking shape but not yet published. The draft mode ensures a secure space to configure a workspace and gives the necessary time to build the same. Any activity in the draft mode will not be exposed to non-members and hence will not impact the support portal in any way. Thus no tickets can be raised to the draft workspace from the support portal. However, agents can raise tickets to this workspace from the agent portal and workspace settings cn


Requesters cannot submit tickets or access service items/solution articles until the admin publishes the workspace to them. 


Published workspace: Once a workspace has been set up, it can be published to requesters from Workspace Settings > Workspace > Publish. 


After that, requesters will be able to view service catalog items and solution articles configured in the workspace. They will also be able to select the workspace in the "Report an Issue" form and raise a ticket to the workspace directly. The name of the field will however be exposed as "Issue related to" instead of "Workspace" to requesters. Admins can choose to hide this field from Global Settings > Field Manager > Workspace Field.
desc_un_html: Draft workspace: Any workspace added to the account is created in draft mode. A draft workspace is a workspace that is being built, configured, and taking shape but not yet published. The draft mode ensures a secure space to configure a workspace and gives the necessary time to build the same. Any activity in the draft mode will not be exposed to non-members and hence will not impact the support portal in any way. Thus no tickets can be raised to the draft workspace from the support portal. However, agents can raise tickets to this workspace from the agent portal and workspace settings cn     Requesters cannot submit tickets or access service items/solution articles until the admin publishes the workspace to them.      Published workspace: Once a workspace has been set up, it can be published to requesters from Workspace Settings > Workspace > Publish.      After that, requesters will be able to view service catalog items and solution articles configured in the workspace. They will also be able to select the workspace in the "Report an Issue" form and raise a ticket to the workspace directly. The name of the field will however be exposed as "Issue related to" instead of "Workspace" to requesters. Admins can choose to hide this field from Global Settings > Field Manager > Workspace Field.

title: What is a primary workspace?
description:
The first workspace created in the account is tagged as the primary workspace. It functions as follows:

  • Any ticket raised will be assigned to the primary workspace if its destination workspace cannot be identified. 

  • If the workspace field has not been enabled for the ‘Report an Issue’ form on the support portal, tickets will be assigned to the primary workspace. If a global workflow rule has been configured, it will route the ticket to the right workspace.

  • If a ticket has been created through a marketplace app, integrations, or API call and the value for the Workspace field is not specified, that ticket will be directed to the primary workspace. 

  • Marketplace Apps that reference your service desk’s form fields can only refer to the primary workspace’s form fields. 

  • Any API request from an integration/custom app/workflow that creates data or retrieves a list of data requires information of the workspace where data needs to be created/retrieved from. In the absence of the workspace ID, the data will be created/pulled from the primary workspace.


Note: Tickets raised via the Service Catalog will be routed to the home workspace of the service item. Tickets raised via email will be assigned to the home workspace of that email address.

It functions as follows:    Any ticket raised will be assigned to the primary workspace if its destination workspace cannot be identified.     If the workspace field has not been enabled for the ‘Report an Issue’ form on the support portal, tickets will be assigned to the primary workspace. If a global workflow rule has been configured, it will route the ticket to the right workspace.    If a ticket has been created through a marketplace app, integrations, or API call and the value for the Workspace field is not specified, that ticket will be directed to the primary workspace.     Marketplace Apps that reference your service desk’s form fields can only refer to the primary workspace’s form fields.     Any API request from an integration/custom app/workflow that creates data or retrieves a list of data requires information of the workspace where data needs to be created/retrieved from. In the absence of the workspace ID, the data will be created/pulled from the primary workspace.       Note: Tickets raised via the Service Catalog will be routed to the home workspace of the service item. Tickets raised via email will be assigned to the home workspace of that email address.

title: How can I deliver a unified service experience to employees with workspaces?
description:
All the departments using Freshservice can deliver employee services via a single support portal.

  • Service Catalog, Solution Articles, and Announcements: All the service items published across workspaces will be available in the support portal for employees to request services from. The same applies to solution articles/announcements. Requesters will not be able to identify which workspace a solution article or service item belongs to. 

  • Reporting Issues: Admins can choose to expose the workspace field in the “Report an Issue” form from Global Settings>Field Manager to forward employee issues directly to the respective workspaces. The field's label will be renamed to "Issue related to" on the requester portal instead of 'Workspace'. If the ‘Workspace’ field is hidden, the issues will be forwarded to the primary workspace from where they can be moved to the destination workspaces manually or via global workflows.
